      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getInput()
      IOUtil::getInput Get user input from user as string with all defaults
      static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String prompt)
      IOUtil::getInput Get user input from user as string with defualt error message and input identifer
      static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      IOUtil::getInput Get user input from user as string with default input identifer

      IOUtil::getInput Get user input from user as string
      static int getInt()
      IOUtil::getInt Get user input from user as int with all defaults
      static int getInt(java.lang.String prompt)
      IOUtil::getInt Get user input from user as int with default input indentifier and error message
      static int getInt(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      IOUtil::getInt Get user input from user as int with default input identifer
      static int getInt(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String errorMessage, java.lang.String inputIdentifer)
      IOUtil::getInt Get user input from user as int
      static void print(java.lang.String output)
      IOUtil::print Wrapper for System.out.print so you can just type print Use `import static danfoad.util.print;`
      static void println(java.lang.String output)
      IOUtil::println Wrapper for System.out.print so you can just type println Use `import static danfoad.util.println;`
      static java.lang.String shellExecute(java.lang.String command)
      IOUtil::shellExecute Execute shell script and return output as string

      • getInput

        public static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                        java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                        java.lang.String inputIdentifer)
        IOUtil::getInput Get user input from user as string
        Parameters:
        String - prompt Prompt to give to user for what to input
        String - errorMessage Error message to return to user on incorrect input
        String - inputIdentifier Display for user input line, e.g. ' > '
        Returns:
        String User inputted string

        Parameters:
